author: wzht
content: Going over some EIPs again relating to chain id, EIP-2294 proposes a 256-bit limit to it's value. EIP-1344 proposes an opcode which returns a 256-bit value. I don't see any other spec that outlines chain id must be an _integer_. It appears this has happened by _convention_ (correct me if I wrong); is there anything relating to chain id specifications where its stated it must be (or not) an integer?

author: wzht
content: The reference implementation for 1344 has a type annotation for an integer
